alert.note: Alert for Eastern Curry County and Josephine County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 28 at 8:20AM PDT until March 28 at 12:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PDT TODAY ABOVE 1000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 1500 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches down to 1000 ft. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches above 2000 ft with locally higher amounts of 3 to 6 inches over the mountains above 3500 feet elevation. Winds gusting 45 to 65 mph over the exposed higher mountains and 20 to 35 mph for elevations below 3500 feet. * WHERE...Eastern Curry County and Josephine County above 1500 feet. This includes Highway 199 at Hayes Hill, portions of Interstate 5 north of Grants Pass, Grayback Road between O`Brien and Happy Camp, Highway 46 east of Cave Junction as well as the Kalmiopsis and Siskiyou Mountains. * WHEN...Until noon PDT today. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of strong winds and snow will result in reduced visibilities and occasional whiteout conditions. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Curry County and Josephine County
